meanings.definition: A person who talks nonsense or dribbles.
meanings.sent1: The drivellers in the park were always telling wild stories.
meanings.sent2: She dismissed him as a driveller when he started rambling about aliens.
meanings.sent3: The drivellers at the party had everyone laughing with their silly jokes.
meanings.sent4: His speech was like a river of drivellers, flowing endlessly without direction.
meanings.sent5: The image of the drivellers gathered around the fountain stuck in her mind.

meanings.sent1: Please stop drivelling and get to the point.
meanings.sent2: He drivellers on and on, never making any sense.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they tried to drivell like the characters in the play.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was so tired that all she could do was drivell incoherently.
meanings.sent5: The politician's speech drivelled on, putting everyone to sleep.
